newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba-Sept bank lending weaker, capital formation up.
newsitem.headline: Buba-Sept bank lending weaker, capital formation up.

text.p: The Bundesbank said on Monday a weakening of bank lending to the private sector and stronger money capital formation were the main reasons for the slowdown in M3 money supply growth in September.
The September growth rate slowed to an annualised, seasonally-adjusted rate of 8.4 percent from 8.7 percent in August, the Bundesbank said in a statement.
The figure was within the 8.2 to 8.5 percent range of forecasts by economists, but above the Bundesbank's four-to-seven target range for 1996.
The Bundesbank also said that lending to the public sector and foreign transactions by domestic non-banks continued to fuel money supply growth.
In addition, non-banks continued to sell money market funds on a net basis, the Bundesbank said.
